Author: soulcrusher
Content: It doesn't matter for a startup. But it does matter if you want a cushy job or want to get into a top professional school.

Author: fruscica

Author: zaidf
Content:
I got rejected from Carnegie-Mellon and Rhode Island School of Design - both top design schools. I was pissed but honestly I never associated those rejections to my startup success. Like PG has said in past, startup is more about determination and ability to learn from failure than any specific school or skill.

If anything just laugh off any rejection you get and keep working towards your startup path.

Author: plusbryan
Content:
Thanks for all the comments, good and bad. They help us refine our test. Keep in mind that we're attempting to figure you out in 40 pairs of pictures. We did this so that lots of people could take it, just to introduce the idea.

A real test would have more like 200 pairs, which is what the YC founders took when we assessed their attributes in the first place.
